name: Joeheywood.github.io
body:
### Welcome to Joe's website
This will eventually be a place to put any code, stuff, ideas, graphs, stuff I might be working on.

```
$ cd your_repo_root/repo_name
$ git fetch origin
$ git checkout gh-pages
```

For Example:

#### Test Table
year|month|link
----|-----|----
2014|3|http://www.nottinghaminsight.org.uk/d/103523
2014|2|http://www.nottinghaminsight.org.uk/d/104927
2014|1|http://www.nottinghaminsight.org.uk/d/103522
2013|12|http://www.nottinghaminsight.org.uk/d/105038
2013|11|http://www.nottinghaminsight.org.uk/d/105153

If you're using the GitHub for Mac, simply sync your repository and you'll see the new branch.

> * Each variable forms a column
> * Each observation forms a row
> * Each type of observational unit forms a table

See [Hadley Wickham's article](http://vita.had.co.nz/papers/tidy-data.pdf) on 
this topic for more information. Sometimes, aspects of the data do not conform 
to this ideal (for example if councils add both the id and name of a 
supplier/category into one column). But I have tried to take out things like 
totals/subtotals rows, empty rows and so on.

### Support or Contact
Having trouble with Pages? Check out the documentation at http://help.github.com/pages or contact support@github.com and weâ€™ll help you sort it out.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
